 
There is a country far away from anyone's notice. Silk is considered extremely valuable there. There is a trader there who sells silk. He does not sell silk cloth, he rather sells silk threads, as he finds it more profitable. The Government there has its own trade rules. The government has prescribed fixed prices (in Singapore dollars) set for different lengths of silk thread. The price of i units length of silk thread is Ai. The trader wants to maximize his profit. He has N units length of silk thread, and the values A1 to AN are also known to him. There is always enough demand for each i^th unit length of silk. He wishes to cut the thread strategically, so that he incurs maximum profit by selling all the pieces of the thread. Help him calculate the maximum profit that he can incur.
 

Input
The first line of input contains T, the number of test cases. Each test case consist of two lines, the first line contains N and the next contains the list of N values A1 to AN.
 

Output
For each test case, output the maximum profit that the trader can incur by selling the thread after cutting it into pieces, strategically.
 

Constraints

1 ≤ T ≤  1000 
1 ≤ N ≤  100 

 

Example
Input:
2
4
2 3 4 5
5
2 5 9 8 10

Output:
8
14
